priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Health Care Encounters Dictionary Derived Term Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C171444

self.title: CDISC SDTM Health Care Encounters Dictionary Derived Term Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist based on the standardized or preprinted name of the healthcare encounter that occurs.
name: Health Care Encounters Dictionary Derived Term
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Health Care Encounters Dictionary Derived Term Terminology
synonyms: Health Care Encounters Dictionary Derived Term

terms.definition: The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional at a cardiac catheterization unit.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a cardiac intensive care unit.
The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional at a cardiology unit.
The subject or patient has interacted with a dietary specialist.
The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional at an emergency room.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a general medical unit of a hospital.
The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional.
The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional within a residence.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a hospital.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a intensive care unit.
The subject or patient has interacted with a mental health specialist.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a neuro-intensive care unit.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a nursing home.
The subject or patient has interacted with a healthcare professional at a physical therapy facility.
The subject or patient has interacted with a primary care physician.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a psychiatric ward.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a rehabilitation facility.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a skilled nursing facility.
The subject or patient has interacted with a specialty care physician.
The subject or patient has been admitted as an inpatient to a surgical intensive care unit.
